history.content:
According to this link that describes CS enrollment policies, the waitlist will be processed in order after Phase II is over. It seems like since you are not EECS or LSCS you should not be able to put yourself on the waitlist until Phase II, but it might be different in the new system. Michael-David Sasson manages the CS enrollments. He is on vacation until 6/13 and can answer more questions once he's back.

Additional information from previous post: We just found out that we have limited capabilities in Cal Central for limiting who can get onto the waitlist, so anyone and everyone can waitlist for upper div CS courses. HOWEVER, WAITLISTS WILL BE PURGED after we process major apps in June. So what does this mean? For all other students who are not-declared, not-CS/EECS, pls wait until phase 2 to sign up for CS upper divs as to not waste your phase 1 units. (You might be able to get on the waitlist now, but if you're not declared when we purge waitlists in June, you'll be removed from the waitlist.)

According to this link that describes CS enrollment policies, the waitlist will be processed in order after Phase II is over. It seems like since you are not EECS or LSCS you should not be able to put yourself on the waitlist until Phase II, but it might be different in the new system. Michael-David Sasson manages the CS enrollments. He is on vacation until 6/13 and can answer more questions once he's back.

According to this link that describes CS enrollment policies, the waitlist will be processed in order after Phase II is over. It seems like since you are not EECS or LSCS you should not be able to put yourself on the waitlist until Phase II, but it might be different in the new system. Michael-David Sasson manages the CS enrollments. He is on vacation until 6/13 and can answer more questions once he's back.

I'm a Cog Sci major (Senior) that wants to take 161 + 168, but I'm not entirely sure what the chances of getting in are. I'm #15 on the waitlist for both, but I'm not sure how the processing works. Also, given that this is the last semester I can take 168, is it possible that I can request some sort of special code to get in from the professor...? I'm genuinely interested in the material in both of these classes and don't want to stay an extra semester just for 168...
history.subject: Cog Sci + Waitlists
